section.section: A carrier shall provide to each applicant an outline of coverage and buyer's guide.

The carrier shall deliver the outline of coverage and buyer's guide:
in the case of solicitation by the carrier or insurance producer of the carrier, before the presentation of an application or enrollment form; and
in the case of direct response solicitation, with the application or enrollment form.

text.section: The buyer's guide shall include information about buying a policy of long-term care insurance, including a reference to the right of the buyer to cancel a policy during the first 30 days after the policy is delivered.

A carrier shall provide an applicant with a graphic comparison, over a period of at least 20 years, of the benefit levels of a policy that increases benefits over the policy or certificate period compared to the benefit levels of a policy that does not increase benefits.
